comments:
I20060314-1200

Variables view unusably small. Each time I open it and Debug Eclipse I have to resize the columns. See attached picture.

Created an attachment (id=36329)
Shows Variables view with way too small columns

Column sizes are persisted when the view is closed via saveMemento(..). Unfortunately, if you close the view manually, this method is not called by the workbench. We pack columns when created, but this only sizes to the width of the header. Perhaps we can use some other metric to create initial column sizes.

This might be related:

The exception happens on manual closing of the view and on workbench shutdown and hence the size isn't restored as well when using the same Variables view again.

Did you test that stuff? ;-)

Actually the sizes are kept upon restart even though this error is logged.
Widget disposed error is fixed (dup of bug 131818).

Created an attachment (id=36372)
Make columns equal width

Patch sets size to tree width / number of columns (instead of pack()) if no size is persisted.
The patch does not work when you manually close/open the view on Windows - when opening the view the tree width is 0 to begin with. The columns end up being 0 wide.

I figured there would be a case where that happened. What about:

if (persisted)
   retore width
else if tree size > 0
   make equal width columns
else
   pack columns (or use a predefined min width)

Just to let you know, #pack does not really work for virtual table.  So, I am not sure if it will work very well for virtual tree with columns.  

For windows, and Linux motif, #pack seems to be able to pack based on the size of elements currently displayed.  For Linux GTK,, #pack does nothing.

You may be better off using #setWidth for all defaults.

See this bug for detail:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=127132

Samantha
Released a fix that packs columns each time entries are added if the user has not set the column size manually. It's not perfect, but it does play better than the existing implementation.
Columns are now sized equally based on view width.
